body:
An employee of Vodafone Egypt Telecommunications Co, wearing a protective face mask, asks customers to follow the restrictions waiting outside a branch, amid concerns over the coronavirus disease (COVID-19), in the Cairo suburb of Maadi, Egypt April 22, 2020. REUTERS/Amr Abdallah Dalsh

(Reuters) - Vodafone Group said on Monday due diligence regarding the potential sale of its 55% stake in its Egyptian unit to Saudi Telecom Co (STC) had been “substantively” completed.

The London-listed telecom firm said that despite the expiry of a memorandum of understanding, the company remains in talks with STC to finalise the transaction in the near future.
title: Vodafone says due diligence on Egypt unit stake sale "substantively" completed
